results.byline: By Alex Travelli, Victoria Kim, Erin Mendell and Isabella Kwai
results.title: India’s Train Crash: What We Know
results.abstract: Three trains, with more than 2,200 people onboard, were involved in the crash in Odisha State, the deadliest such disaster in decades. The death toll approached 300.

results.adx_keywords: Retirement;Social Media;Age, Chronological;Personal Finances;Online Advertising;Income;Elderly;TikTok (ByteDance)
results.title: As Older TikTok Creators Flourish, Brands Are Signing Them Up
results.abstract: No matter what their age or finances, some elder influencers are finding that being on the app can bring them extra cash, or even help them extend their careers.

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Lawyers Unable to Find Document Trump Discussed in Recorded Conversation
results.abstract: Prosecutors issued a subpoena for a description of military options for Iran mentioned by the former president during an interview. But Mr. Trump’s legal team said they could find no such document.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump seated next to Gen. Mark A. Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, during a meeting with senior military leaders at the White House in 2019. The subpoena sought all documents related to General Milley and Iran.

results.adx_keywords: Eating Disorders;Therapy and Rehabilitation;internal-sub-only
results.title: The Most Common Eating Disorder in the U.S. Is Also the Least Understood
results.abstract: Binge eating disorder entered the diagnostic manual on mental health conditions 10 years ago. It’s still getting overlooked.

results.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Anatoly Kurmanaev
results.title: Car Bombing in Russian-Occupied Ukraine Shows Reach of War
results.abstract: The blast in the Zaporizhzhia region of southern Ukraine killed a cafe owner who was registered to run in elections seen as an attempt to legitimize Moscow’s illegal annexation of the area.

media.caption: Members of Ukraine’s 95th Air Assault Brigade fired at Russian positions in eastern Ukraine on Friday.

results.byline: By Sameer Yasir, Mujib Mashal and Hari Kumar
results.title: India’s Worst Rail Disaster in Decades Convulses Country Dependent on Trains
results.abstract: The disaster killed at least 288 people, and a preliminary government report described it as a “three-way accident” involving two passenger trains and an idled cargo train. Officials were investigating possible signal failure.

media.caption: Railway workers used excavators to remove wreckage from the derailment and collision in an effort to bring the tracks back into service.

results.byline: By Frances Robles and Andre Paultre
results.title: Vigilante Justice Rises in Haiti and Crime Plummets
results.abstract: Civilians have killed at least 160 gang members in Haiti, a human rights group says. Residents say they feel safer, but others worry that it will lead to even more violence.

media.caption: Men with machetes, part of a self-defense initiative to keep gangs from gaining control of their neighborhood, in Port-au-Prince, Haiti.

results.byline: By Chris Cameron and Mark Walker
results.title: Two Black Members of Native Tribes Were Arrested. The Law Sees Only One as Indian.
results.abstract: A Supreme Court ruling barred Oklahoma from prosecuting crimes committed by Native Americans on tribal land, but some Black tribal members are still being prosecuted because they lack “Indian blood.”

media.caption: Michael J. Hill, a Cherokee Nation citizen in Oklahoma, is being prosecuted in state court because he was found to not be legally Indian.

results.title: Trump Lawyer’s Notes Could Be a Key in the Classified Documents Inquiry
results.abstract: M. Evan Corcoran recorded recollections of his legal work last year for Donald Trump. The recording is now in the hands of prosecutors, unnerving some aides to the former president.
